column2: A weekend residential retreat organized by Madison Insight held at Pine Lake Retreat Center in rural Wisconsin.

column6: Session title

column3: 2023-10-13 Madison Insight Retreat 2023 Ajahn Pasanno Day 1 Q+A.mp3
2023-10-14 Madison Insight Retreat 2023 Ajahn Pasanno Day 2 Q+A.mp3
2023-10-15 Madison Insight Retreat 2023 Ajahn Pasanno Day 3 Q+A.mp3

column6: Text
In the dialogue between Ānanda and Sariputta (AN 4.179), could you say more about the reason people don't become enlightened in this lifetime?

Tibetan Buddhism seems to have a stronger emphasis on compassion and emptiness as a practice. Can you talk about this from the perspective of the Ajahn Chah lineage, including steps as to how it is done?
"What is the mind of an Arahant like?" – "Only compassion"|Ajahn Mahā Boowa
Can you expand more on the seeing through of vipassanā?
Please speak about sense consciouness and how the release of attachment is acheived.
Dhamma practice is not difficult. There are only two things you need to do: know and let go.|Ajahn Chah
How does one know the difference between appropriate grieving and honoring the memory of a beloved versus clinging and attachment?
Grieving for Ajahn Chah.
It's that personalization of experience that gets us into trouble over and over again in different ways.
Could you give a Dhamma talk about the Five Aggregates?
A dog tied to a post (SN 22.100).
I'm a mother to four kids, one of whom has special needs. I'm lucky if I can meditate 10-15 minutes a day. Are there practices one can do when one is frequently around little ones?
Path of Purification p. 104: Forty subjects of meditation.
Sri Lankan Buddhists keep a book of good deeds which is read near the time of death.
Debbie Stamp served as primary caregiver to her father during the pandemic.

By moving to lovingkindness [meditation], I may be missing some of the deeper insights and wisdom that are present in feelings of angher, ill-will, and resentment. I think this is what is referred to as spiritual bypassing. Can you speak to this distinction or provide suggestions for accessing the wisdom that may be present within or underneath the hindrances?

Sensual desire is just trying to get a relief from suffering. Even anger and ill-will...and the same with all the rest of the hindrances. They are looking for some relief from suffering in some way, shape, or form.
Would you speak about your response to the events in Israel and Gaza?
The world has been a sad place for a long time.
Could you please elaborate on how you generate the images and feelings of metta? My metta practice phrases always seem a bit dry.
I have trouble maintaining wakefulness and alertness in the afternoon. What guidance would you give to cultivate more skillfulness?

I have had many losses over the year, and both my parents passed away six years ago. I found that taking refuge in the Buddha, Dhamma, and Saṅgha, keeping the precepts, and having daily meditation practice helps. There is peacefulness and gratitude. I have heard that if one wants to share merits with the deceased, one could. What is the proper way? Could you give some guidance?
Iti 22: "Do not be afraid of puñña."
Puñña is accomplished through the heart itself.
A spark of merit is worth more than a mountain of effort.|Tibetan saying
In practicing mindfulness day-to-day, which category of mindfulness is most important at varying times? Body, feelings, mind, or dhammas?
Upon awakening one morning, I found my mind was locked open in awareness. It seems this was stable as long as I did not do any conceptual thinking. Is this a feature of samādhi? Can it be cultivated?
Can you offer practical advice for working with hindrances and cultivating sīla without taking it personally, that is, trying to perfect the personality?
_Kae nun lae_ (Thai) – It's just this much.|Ajahn Chah
Please offer your thoughts on how to cultivate the brahmavihāras on and off the cushion.
Ajahn Vajiro defined the brahamavihāras as the mature emotions.
What are the words or practices to develop equanimity? In this difficult, divisive period, it's helpful to have as much non-ill-will as possible.
[News] is not there to inform you. It's there to create a reaction....Their job is to try to get click baits.
Can you be a Buddhist and yet an I-don't-know agnostic about reincarnation?
MN 60: The Safe Bet
How does one navigate choices and self-advocacy and also equanimity? I often find myself feeling relatively content yet defaulting slightly to people-pleasing and being quiet to get along.
I am in a challenging situation at work and thinking of moving to a different position. How can I tell whether this is skillful or unskillful?

The world looms large. This is the source of most of my turmoil. How does one see all this strife as neutral when we know that the damage to the world is so great? How do we maintain acceptance when our children and grandchildren will suffer?
Any suggestions for managing dizziness or nausea from the energy on retreat? I'm feeling a little overwhelmed today.
How does one reconcile perceived imperfections and unskillful behaivor in Buddhist institutions and interactions with teachers?
The Buddha set up an institution that was not assuming infallability.
Dhp 227: Nobody lives without criticism.
Fifty vassas! Highs, lows? What are you contemplating these days?
Can you talk about fear as a cause of dukkha and how to work with it?
In terms of personality, [fear] was my go-to option.

When one moves through the world with compassion and lovingkindness, how does one avoid feeling depleted? In a world of 'individuals,' most take more than they give and to always be giving can be exhausting.
When we are attentive to freedom from suffering, there's an inexhaustible well of goodness there.

I wake remembering dreams my dreams often and at times in the dream I know that I am dreaming. There are interesting aspects to this, but also at times I find it intense or tiring. Meditation before bed seems to intesify this. Suggestions?
Ajahn Pasanno's Tibetan doctor insists he needs more sleep.

My husband died 10 years ago. There was sadness but also relief that his journey was over and sadness and relief for myself. I can still hear his advice regarding my medications. Is this clinging? He lives in my heart. What do you do with memories and teachings yourself?
I still hear Ajahn Chah's voice.
Ajahn Pasanno mentions the Question and Story Archive.
When I go inward, I don't feel or experience brightness. Instead it/I feel heavy. How can I get to that brightness?
When one is caught in depression or negativity, how can one brighten or uplift the mind?
Would you be willing to share memories of Ajahn Chah?
When asked about the core essence of the Buddha's teachings, Ajahn Chah replies, "Is this a big stick or a little stick?"
Ajahn Chah pretends to forget simple questions in order to embarass his translator.
Ajahn Pasanno writes to his family that he's staying in Thailand because Ajahn Chah is peaceful, solid, clear, and unshakeable in the midst of all that's going on around him.
What's your opinion of the secular mindfulness movement (MBSR and its associated programs)? Can mindfulness serve a useful function for people without the rest of the Dhamma?
Please, a short talk on Nibbāna.
Nibbāna is not a thing.
Ud 3.10: _Yena yena hi maññati, tato taṁ hoti aññathā._ – "For however one conceives it, it is always other than that."
[The Island]()
What exactly is reborn in Buddhist teachings?
Could you comment on the phrase in the Metta Sutta, "Not born again into this world?"
Chanting Book p. 37
"What is the mind of an Arahant like?" – "Only compassion"|Ajahn Mahā Boowa
